main event: A silver object in the shape of an isosceles triangle was sighted northwest of Victoria, Texas.
interesting points: The object had a base approximately 1/2 to 1/3 as long as the sides, and had a light off the triangle.
The object could be covered by a golf ball held at arm's length.
The object left small vapor trails and moved at a high speed, described as twice as fast as an F-100C aircraft.
The object was first sighted southeast of the observer at an altitude of 10,000 to 15,000 feet, then climbed and blinked out.
The sighting was made by an employee of the Southern Pacific Railroad who was an Air Force Reserve aircraft observer.
sighted object: Silver object in the shape of an isosceles triangle
witnesses: Employee of Southern Pacific Railroad, Air Force Reserve aircraft observer
